SEARCH
Package com.bteam.common.utils

Class TurnLogic

java.lang.Object
com.bteam.common.utils.TurnLogic
public class TurnLogic extends Object
Service for turn-based game logic.

This service handles the logic for processing movements, attacks, character deaths, and determining the winner for each turn in the game.

  • Method Details

    • applyCommands

      public static TurnResult applyCommands(List<MovementDataModel> moves, List<CharacterEntity> characters, List<AttackDataModel> attacks, GridService gridService, String hostID)
      Applies all the commands (movements and attacks) for a turn and updates the character states.
      Parameters:
      moves - List of movement commands received.
      characters - List of all characters in the game.
      attacks - List of attack commands received.
      gridService - Grid service for the game board.
      hostID - PlayerID of the hosting player.
      Returns:
      A TurnResult object containing the updated character states, valid movements, valid attacks, and any movement conflicts.

    • checkForDeaths

      public static void checkForDeaths(List<CharacterEntity> characters, GridService gridService)

    • applyMovement

      public static void applyMovement(List<MovementDataModel> intendedMovements, List<CharacterEntity> characters, GridService gridService)
      Applies all valid movements to the characters.
      Parameters:
      intendedMovements - List of valid movement commands.
      characters - List of all characters in the game.
      gridService - The GridService of the game.

    • applyAttacks

      public static void applyAttacks(List<AttackDataModel> intendedAttacks, List<CharacterEntity> characters, GridService gridService, String hostId)
      Applies all valid attacks to the characters.
      Parameters:
      intendedAttacks - List of valid attack commands.
      characters - List of all characters in the game.
      gridService - The GridService of the game.

    • checkForWinner

      public static String checkForWinner(List<CharacterEntity> characters)
      Checks if the game has a winner by determining if all remaining characters belong to one player.
      Parameters:
      characters - List of all characters in the game.
      Returns:
      The player ID of the winner, or null if no winner exists.
